text:
Premier League
Manchester United: Pogba under plaster for another ten days!
After Manchester United's defeat at Bournemouth, French player Paul Pogba, still injured, spoke.
02 Nov 2019, 22:40 by Hugo Deloraine



Manchester UnitedManchester United is preparing to tackle a pivotal season. Deprived of the Champions League and sixth in the last Premier League championship, the Red Devils must return to the top in the coming months. With which eleven-type? Icon Sport



David de GeaIcon Sport



Luke ShawIcon Sport



Chris SmallingIcon Sport



Victor Lindel√∂fIcon Sport



Aaron Wan-BissakaIcon Sport



Paul PogbaIcon Sport



Nemanja MatiƒáIcon Sport



Anthony MartialIcon Sport



Jesse LingardIcon Sport



Marcus RashfordIcon Sport



Romelu LukakuIcon Sport

Manchester United: the possible eleven of the season




"Disgusted!" That's how Paul Pogba was after the match between Bournemouth and Manchester United. Indeed, the Red Devils do not fare in this start of the championship. By bowing to Bournemouth 1-0, United is now in eighth place after 11 days. Too little for the Mancunians. Pogba also took the opportunity to speak about his injury.




A long absence




Manchester United + 12 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

At the microphone of RMC Sport, the French world champion said that "it would be plastered another 10 days" before "two weeks of rehabilitation". As a reminder, after three weeks of absence, the French midfielder had relapsed against Arsenal on September 30th. An absence that weighs heavily for the Red Devils.
